The triangular cutout has a base of approximately 1 unit and a height of approximately 0.5 units.** 1. **Create a new coordinate system for part 1:** ```json "coordinate_system": { "Euler Angles": [ 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 ], "Translation Vector": [ 0.0, 0.5123, 0.0 ] } ``` 2. **Draw the base face of the rectangular prism as a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system:** ```json "sketch": { "face_1": { "loop_1": { ... } } } ``` 3. **Define the first loop of the sketch as a closed sequence of lines:** ```json "line_1": { "Start Point": [0.0, 0.75], "End Point": [0.2656, 0.3855] }, "line_2": { "Start Point": [0.2656, 0.3855], "End Point": [0.2239, 0.062] }, "line_3": { "Start Point": [0.2239, 0.062], "End Point": [0.5113, 0.0] }, "line_4": { "Start Point": [0.5113, 0.0], "End Point": [0.5731, 0.2862] }, "line_5": { "Start Point": [0.5731, 0.2862], "End Point": [0.5556, 0.3943] }, "line_6": { "Start Point": [0.5556, 0.3943], "End Point": [0.2789, 0.3943] }, "line_7": { "Start Point": [0.2789, 0.3943], "End Point": [0.3818, 0.75] }, "line_8": { "Start Point": [0.3818, 0.75], "End Point": [0.0, 0.75] } ``` 4. **Create a 3D part by extruding the sketch along the Z-axis:** ```json "extrusion": { "extrude_depth_towards_normal": 0.5123, "extrude_depth_opposite_normal": 0.0, "sketch_scale": 0.75, "operation": "NewBodyFeatureOperation" } ``` 5. **Use the provided parameters and constraints to generate the final 3D model, ensuring that it matches the description provided in the "description" field of the JSON object.**</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0 and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0.1193]. On this coordinate system, create a new sketch. In this sketch, create a new face. On this face, create a new loop. Create a circle in this loop with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. Close the loop. Extrude the sketch by 0.2216 towards the normal. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. This will create a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, symmetrical along its central axis, and with a slightly tapered middle section. **Part 2: Smaller Cylindrical Object** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0 and a translation vector of [0.242, 0.242, 0.1193]. On this coordinate system, create a new sketch. In this sketch, create a new face. On this face, create a new loop. Create a circle in this loop with a center at [0.133, 0.133] and a radius of 0.133. Close the loop. Extrude the sketch by 0.1193 towards the normal. Set the sketch scale to 0.2659. This will create a smaller cylindrical object that will be joined to the previous cylindrical object. **Part 3: Even Smaller Cylindrical Object** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0 and a translation vector of [0.2898, 0.2898, 0.1193]. On this coordinate system, create a new sketch. In this sketch, create a new face. On this face, create a new loop. Create a circle in this loop with a center at [0.0852, 0.0852] and a radius of 0.0852. Close the loop. Extrude the sketch by 0 towards the normal. Set the sketch scale to 0.1705. This will create an even smaller cylindrical object that will be added as a new body feature. **Part 4: Additional Cylindrical Object** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0, 0, 0 and a translation vector of [0.179, 0.179, 0.1193]. On this coordinate system, create a new sketch. In this sketch, create a new face. On this face, create a new loop. Create a circle in this loop with a center at [0.196, 0.196] and a radius of 0.196. Close the loop. Extrude the sketch by 0.1534 towards the normal. Set the sketch scale to 0.392. This will create an additional cylindrical object that will be added as a new body feature. The final shape will be a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, approximately three times its diameter in height, and with a smooth surface. The object is made up of several cylindrical components, some with flat tops and bottoms, and some with smaller diameters. The final object may have a slightly tapered middle section, depending on the dimensions of the initial sketch.</description>
